title: India’s most popular services are becoming super apps
text: Truecaller, an app that helps users screen strangers and robocallers, will soon allow users in India, its largest market, to borrow up to a few hundred dollars in the nation. The crediting option will be the fourth feature the nine-year-old app adds to its service in the last two years.

title: Uber Fails to Attract Surge-Level Prices for Its IPO
text: Uber shares opened below the IPO price while the S&P 500 brushed off the tariff increase and the VIX dropped back below 18.

title: U.S. says Huawei lawyer's prior work at Justice Department poses conflict
text: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd lawyer James Cole's prior work at the Department of Justice created a conflict of interest that should disqualify him from defending the Chinese company in a case over alleged bank fraud and sanctions violations, U.S. prosecutors said in a filing on Friday.

title: Cramer's week ahead: The market can go higher with Uber's IPO, tariffs behind us
text: "We made it through hell week ... We can finally start talking about earnings and interest rates again," Jim Cramer says.

title: U.S.-China trade talks stall over draft deal revisions: sources
text: The United States and China made no progress in trade talks this week in Washington as U.S. negotiators rejected Chinese Vice Premier Liu He's arguments in favor of China's proposed legal changes to a draft agreement, two sources familiar with the talks told Reuters.

title: Factbox: Here are nine categories of consumer products impacted by Trump's new tariffs
text: A range of consumer products made in China and sold in the United States are affected by Friday's new set of tariffs imposed by U.S. President Donald Trump, including in categories such as vacuum cleaners, handbags and lighting fixtures.

title: How To Invest In Cannabis As The Industry Matures
text: Although the legal marijuana industry is still very much an emerging niche for stock market participants, the market for investing in cannabis is maturing.

title: Wall Street Weekahead: Trade turbulence shows market vulnerability as stocks get pricier
text: Stock valuations have climbed to levels reached just before Wall Street's late 2018 plunge, leaving the market at risk of shocks such as the sell-off this week as global trade tensions mounted.

title: You Won't Believe What the Insiders are Buying in 2019
text: Insiders from a certain sector have been buying shares of late. Learn about the space and how to get involved.

title: Stocks claw back early losses as trade tensions escalate; S&P, Nasdaq see worst week of 2019
text: Stocks clawed back early losses to end mostly higher Friday, but the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite still suffered the biggest weekly declines of 2019 as trade tensions between the U.S. and China escalated.

title: Trump is playing the 'long game' in China trade talks: Former White House trade advisor
text: Trump is taking a "calculated approach" to trade talks with China to get a long-term solution, says Clete Willems, former trade negotiator.

title: What You Should Know About Internet Privacy, And How Little You Have
text: U.S. lawmakers want new internet privacy laws. But experts say you should get proactive about data security now and limit how much information you expose.

title: Meet Bobbie, a baby formula delivery startup promising healthier ingredients
text: Don’t like the idea of your baby guzzling down liquid candy all day? It may surprise you to find corn syrup is the main ingredient in most infant formulas in the U.S.

title: Here Come The China Downgrades
text: PNC Financial lowers its forecast for China GDP. Sees sub-6% growth for rest of the year.

title: Wall St hit by trade uncertainty; Uber makes tepid debut
text: U.S. stocks were off session lows on Friday, but the benchmark S&P 500 remained on track for its worst weekly loss since December, as investors fretted over a potential long-drawn U.S.-China trade war.

title: Warren Buffett's tribute to a legendary investor reveals 3 secrets to living an extraordinary life
text: "Walter Lippmann spoke of men who plant trees that other men will sit under. Ben Graham was such a man," the billionaire said of his mentor.

title: WeWork's starry valuation dazzles landlords, reaffirms doubters
text: WeWork's $47 billion valuation as it heads toward what may be the year's largest initial public offering after ride-hailing firm Uber has made the flexible office space start-up the envy of landlords and the target of skeptics at a time when rents have barely kept pace with inflation.

title: Does It Ever Make Sense to Own More Bonds Than Stocks?
text: In some cases, absolutely.

title: Watch Jeff Bezos unveil his grand space plans here
text: Grizzled TechCrunch reporter Matt Burns was on site at yesterday’s big Blue Origin reveal, but if you’re reading this right now, odds are you weren’t. It was a small gathering, and Jeff Bezos, who tends to be fairly secret for such a public billionaire, opted not to live stream the fairly intimate press conference.

title: Retailers, already planning for the 2019 holidays, expected to get whacked with new Trump tariffs
text: Meanwhile, President Donald Trump has threatened to slap 25% tariffs on another $325 billion in Chinese goods that still remain untaxed, after Friday's hike. And that list of goods includes apparel, toys and footwear.

title: U.S. escalates trade war amid negotiations, China says it will hit back
text: The United States escalated a tariff war with China on Friday by hiking levies on $200 billion worth of Chinese goods amid last-ditch talks to rescue a trade deal, as U.S. President Donald Trump signaled that talks could drag on beyond this week.

title: Virgin Atlantic in, IAG out of race for Thomas Cook airline business
text: The chief executive of British Airways owner IAG ruled out bidding for Thomas Cook's airline unit on Friday, a day after rival Virgin Atlantic was reported to be interested in part of the business.

title: Here's what Wall Street thinks of the unfolding trade deal drama: 'Potential for a bear market'
text: "The next focal point for markets will be whether we see Trump and Liu actually meet," Deutsche Bank said.

title: Stocks gain on trade deal hopes, set for worst week since December
text: Global stocks made gains on Friday as investors held out hopes for a trade deal between the United States and China, even as another round of U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods took effect.

title: Oil Climbs Even After U.S. Tariff Hike As Supply Outlook Tight
text: Oil managed to push higher even after the U.S. went ahead with a planned tariff increase on Chinese goods, as rising tensions in Iran and elsewhere.

title: Exclusive: Thyssenkrupp to consider partial listing of elevators business, abandons split
text: Thyssenkrupp is considering a carve-out or listing of its elevators business after abandoning plans to split itself up with a cross-shareholding structure, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Friday.

title: The True Cost Of Hedging S&P Downside
text: Using SPY puts is a common form of hedging a portfolio's stock exposure.

title: U.S. stock futures slip after tariff increase takes effect
text: U.S. stock futures fell and Asian shares pared gains on Friday after U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff increase on $200 billion worth of Chinese goods took effect, ratcheting up tensions between the world's two biggest economies.
